Seedha band mat karna - that will make headache bahut zyada bura ho jayega. Roz ek cup kam karo slowly, like ek hafte mein ek ek cup reduce karo. Gradual hai slow but safe tarika hai yaar.
I started taking sleep meds because I couldn't sleep. Now I can't sleep at all without them even after 6 months.
6 months on sleep meds and now totally dependent on them - that's concerning bro. Does your doctor know you've been on them this long?
I switched doctors because the first one tried to reduce my dosage. I need them to function. Without them I just lie there panicking all night.

Bro I have to be honest with you - switching doctors just to keep getting the meds is a red flag. Your body is fully dependent now and the panic without them is actually withdrawal, not your original insomnia. You're not solving the sleep problem anymore, you're just managing the dependency. Going back to a doctor who will help you taper off slowly is important yaar - you can't keep this up forever. It's not easy to hear but continuing like this will only make it harder to come off later.
Pornography dekh raha hoon bahut zyada - har roz, kabhi kabhi din mein bhi. Relationship mein bhi interest kam ho raha hai.
Yaar har roz aur din mein bhi, aur relationship mein interest kam - yeh clearly affecting kar raha hai real life ko bhi. Kitne time se hai yeh pattern?
2 saal se zyada. Pehle weekend pe tha, ab daily ho gaya hai. Real relationship feel karna zyada mushkil ho gaya hai ab. Girlfriend ke saath bhi connected nahi feel hoti.

Yaar seedha bolunga - yeh porn addiction hai aur iska real relationship pe serious impact ho raha hai. Brain ab virtual stimulation pe trained ho gaya hai aur real connection boring lag raha hai uske compared. 2 saal se hai toh akele band karna mushkil hoga. Girlfriend ko bata sakte ho - I know scary hai but woh deserve karti hai to know. Aur honestly ek professional se baat karna important hai yaar, yeh willpower ki baat nahi hai, yeh brain chemistry hai.
I spend all my free time buying and selling sneakers online. It started as a hobby but now I'm obsessed. My whole day revolves around it.
Hobby turning into obsession where your whole day revolves around it - that's a big shift bro. Are you actually making money or just spending more?
Honestly I'm losing money. But the thrill of finding a deal or making a sale feels like a high. I can't stop checking apps every 10 minutes.

Okay so the money isn't even the point - it's the thrill, the dopamine hit of the deal. Checking every 10 minutes, losing money but still doing it - that's addictive behavior bro. The 'high' you're feeling is brain releasing dopamine on the chase, not the actual outcome. Yeh gambling jaisa hi pattern hai - thrill chase. Try karo apps delete karo phone se for a day, see how restless you actually feel without it - that will show you how deep it goes.
Yaar mujhe pata hai ki social media bahut time le raha hai par har notification pe seedha phone haath mein aa jaata hai. Koi bhi kaam 5 min tak nahi chal sakta bina check kiye.
Har notification pe seedha phone haath mein - woh automatic response hai yaar. Kaam mein actually suffer ho raha hai?
Haan bilkul. Deadlines miss ho rahe hain, meetings mein dhyan nahi lagta. Boss ne bhi comment kiya hai ki focus nahi hai. Par notification aati hai toh ruk hi nahi sakta.

Yaar dekh, 'ruk nahi sakta' - yeh normal nahi hai. Social media notifications intentionally designed hoti hain brain ko trigger karne ke liye, aur tumhara brain ab conditioned ho gaya hai respond karne ke liye automatically. Job bhi affect ho raha hai yaar - yeh serious hai. Phone mein Do Not Disturb mode lagao work hours mein aur notifications completely off karo - force karo khud ko. First 2-3 din mushkil lagega but brain adjust ho jayega. Agar phir bhi ruk na pao toh app blocking tools use karo jaise Freedom ya similar.
Raat ko neend nahi aati toh whiskey peeta hoon so jaane ke liye. Ab roz raat ko peena zaroori ho gaya hai. Bina iske aankhein khuli rehti hain poori raat.
Roz raat ko zaroori ho gaya hai neend ke liye aur bina iske bilkul nahi aayi - yeh dependency hai yaar. Pehle kitna peeta tha raat ko?
Pehle ek peg tha. Ab teen tak ho jaate hain. Aur subah uthke bhi fresh nahi feel hota. Headache aati hai.

Yaar dekh, alcohol actually neend ki quality ruin karta hai - tumhe lagta hai so ja rahe ho but deep sleep nahi hoti isse. Isliye subah fresh nahi feel hota aur zyada peena padta hai cycle continue karne ke liye. Ek peg se teen peg - yeh escalation hai. Neend ke liye alcohol use karna long term mein bahut dangerous hai body ke liye. Doctor ko honestly batao - woh better alternative de sakte hain neend ke liye jo actually kaam karega bina side effects ke.
I can't stop eating even when I'm full. I just keep eating out of habit. Late night fridge raids are a daily thing now.
Eating even when full and late night raids daily - that's not hunger driving it bro. What's usually going through your mind when it happens?
Nothing really. I'm just bored or stressed and the fridge is right there. I don't even taste the food half the time. It's just mindless.

Exactly bro - mindless eating. You're not eating because you're hungry, you're eating because boredom or stress needs to be filled and food is the easiest thing available. Brain gets a small dopamine hit from eating regardless of hunger. Yeh compulsive eating hai. Try karo - jab bhi fridge ke paas jaao without being hungry, pehle 10 minute wait karo and do something else - water piyo, phone check karo, kuch bhi. Delay the action and urge might actually pass yaar.
Yaar mera dost hookah peene deta hai har weekend. Pehle fun tha par ab bina iske weekend boring lagta hai. Gale mein bhi irritation hoti hai par band nahi kar pa raha.
Gale mein irritation hoti hai aur phir bhi band nahi kar pa raha - woh body ka sign hai yaar. Hookah ne kitne time mein regular become kiya?
6 mahine ho gaye roughly. Pehle ek baar peeta tha par ab har Saturday aur Sunday dono pe peeta hoon. Aur ab weekday mein bhi kabhi kabhi mann karta hai.

Yaar dekh, 6 mahine mein once a week se har din ka mann karna - yeh dependency develop ho rahi hai. Hookah mein nicotine hoti hai aur woh same way addictive hai jaise cigarette. Body irritated hai but brain demand kar raha hai - isliye band nahi ho raha. Weekend fun ke liye shuru tha par ab 'boring without it' feel karna matlab brain already expect karna shuru kar diya hai. Dost ko bata aur try karo one weekend bina iske - honestly dekho kaisa feel hota hai body ko.
Yaar roz raat ko online sports betting karta hoon. Shuru mein fun tha but ab serious money laga raha hoon. Kabhi kabhi poori salary ek hafte mein chali jaati hai.
Poori salary ek hafte mein - yaar woh fun nahi raha yeh. Kitne time se regular betting kar raha hai aur kab se itna serious hua?
6 mahine se. Aur jab haara toh double bet karta hoon recover karne ke liye. Raat bhar jaag ke dusre desh ke matches dekh raha hoon sirf iske liye.

Yaar 'double bet karna recover karne ke liye' - woh exactly gambling addiction ka pattern hai. Salary ja rahi hai aur raat bhar jaag rahe ho - body aur finances dono suffer kar rahe hain. Yeh control mein nahi hai anymore yaar. Betting apps delete karo phone se abhi aur kisi trusted person ko batao - akele isme nahi ruk sakte ho.
I can't stop buying skincare products. Every new launch I order immediately. My bathroom shelf is completely full but I still keep buying more. It feels like a compulsion honestly.
Shelf full but still ordering every new launch - that's beyond normal skincare bro. What happens in your head when you see a new product drop?
Immediate excitement - like I genuinely need it right now. I think 'this one will finally fix my skin.' But after buying I feel guilty because nothing actually changes.

That 'this one will finally fix it' feeling every single time - that's dopamine talking bro, not your skin actually needing anything. Same excitement, same disappointment, same loop. Your skin is probably fine with what you already have. The buying itself is the addiction. Try a 30 day no-buy rule yaar - use only what's already on that shelf. See how uncomfortable that feels.
Yaar roz subah uthke seedha Reddit pe jaata hoon. Ghanton tak threads padhta rehta hoon. Poora din ka mood depend karta hai uspe ki kya padha hai.
Poora din ka mood Reddit pe depend karta hai - matlab woh sirf reading nahi hai, woh tumhara emotional state set kar raha hai. Kaunse subreddits zyada dekh rahe ho?
Mostly negative ones yaar - drama, arguments, dark humor wale. Ajeeb hai na but woh engaging lagte hain. Positive content boring lagta hai ab.

Yaar negative content engaging isliye lagta hai kyunki brain ko conflict aur drama pe dopamine milta hai - it's literally how it's designed. Positive boring lagta hai kyunki brain ab high stimulation pe trained ho chuka hai. Aur woh same negative content hi tumhara mood ruin kar raha hai din bhar. Woh dark subreddits leave karo - algorithm wahi dikhata hai jo tum dekh rahe ho. Input badlo, mood automatically badlega.

I text people constantly - can't put my phone down even when I'm sitting with someone. I'm messaging 3-4 people at the same time all through the day. If I stop for even an hour I feel like everyone will forget about me.
3-4 people simultaneously all day and that fear of being forgotten - that's a lot of mental weight bro. Even when someone is right in front of you, you're texting others?
Yeah even during lunch with friends I'm texting others. My friends here have actually pointed it out. But the second I put the phone down I feel anxious like I'm missing out on something.

Bro, friends are literally sitting right there and you're texting others instead - that anxiety when you put phone down is real but nothing is actually going anywhere. Your brain is just trained to always be plugged in. The actual connection happening in front of you is getting ignored. Try one meal completely phone free yaar - just be present with the people actually there. Those texts can wait, they're not disappearing.
Yaar online gaming mein loot boxes kharid raha hoon bahut zyada. Har naye skin pe paise laga raha hoon. Pata nahi total mein kitna kharch ho chuka hai abhi tak.
Pata nahi kitna kharch hua - matlab tracking bhi nahi hai yaar. Rare skin milne pe kaisa feel hota hai?
Thoda achha feel hota hai jab rare skin milta hai - jaise ek choti si achievement hai. Par agar nahi milta toh 'ek aur try' karta rehta hoon ghanton tak.

Yaar 'ek aur try' ghanton tak aur pata nahi kitna kharch hua - yeh loot box addiction hai clearly. Rare skin milna ek choti chance hai but brain uski chase pe stuck ho jaata hai - gambling jaisa mechanism hai. Real money ja raha hai virtual items ke liye yaar. Game mein payment method hatao seedha - aur tracking start karo ki actually kitna ja raha hai. Sometimes just seeing the number is enough to wake up.
Yaar roz subah uthke seedha Reddit pe jaata hoon but actually research ke naam pe YouTube, articles, Wikipedia - ek se doosra, teesra. Kabhi band nahi hota. Koi studying nahi hota actually.
Research ke naam pe par actually koi reading nahi ho rahi - woh rabbit hole hai yaar. Kitne time se yeh pattern hai ki actually study nahi hota?
Bahut time se. Dimag mein lagta hai ki 'ek aur article padh lunga phir kaam shuru karunga' - lekin woh 'ek aur' kabhi last nahi hota. Subah uthke lagta hai ki kuch kiya nahi.

Yaar 'ek aur' kabhi last nahi hota - woh procrastination loop hai aur brain ko feel hota hai ki research karna productive hai but actually kuch output nahi aa raha. Guilt subah aata hai par raat ko wahi loop repeat hota hai. Ek rule banao - research ke liye specific 30 min time set karo, uske baad screen band. Jo kaam karna hai woh pehle karo, research baad mein.
I've been hoarding clothes - buying constantly from apps like Zara, H&M, Shein. My closet is overflowing, tags still on most of them. I wear like 10% of what I own. But I keep buying.
Tags still on most of them and closet overflowing - so you're not even wearing what you buy bro. What triggers you to order a new one?
Usually when I'm stressed or bored. The moment I click 'add to cart' there's this little rush. And sales make it worse - I feel like I'm missing out if I don't grab the deal.

Stress and boredom leading straight to buying - your brain found shopping as a quick dopamine hit for those feelings bro. And that 'missing the deal' feeling - that's manufactured urgency, the apps are literally designed to create that pressure. You're not saving money, you're spending it on stuff you never wear. Delete those shopping apps yaar. Next time stress or boredom hits, notice the urge but don't act on it - just sit with it for 10 minutes.
Yaar main har meal pe phone haath mein rakhta hoon. Khaate khaate YouTube dekh raha hoon ya Instagram scroll. Bina screen ke plate ke saamne baithna feel nahi hota.
Bina screen ke baithna feel nahi hota - matlab eating time bhi brain ko sirf food se occupied nahi rakh sakta. Kabse yeh shuru hua tha yaar?
Lockdown mein akele khana khaate waqt shuru hua tha. Tab se kabhi bina phone ke khana nahi khaya. Family ke saath bhi phone haath mein hota hai. Maa ne bola hai band karo but nahi hua.

Lockdown mein akela tha isliye screen tha - makes sense. Par ab family ke saath bhi band nahi ho raha aur maa ne bola hai - yaar yeh habit itni deep ho chuki hai ki automatically haath phone pe jaata hai. Ek meal try karo bina phone ke yaar - just ek. Khana actually taste karo, dekho kaisa lagta hai. Awkward lagega pehle definitely, but that discomfort is worth feeling once.

Mujhe pata hai ki mujhe social comparison nahi karni chahiye but har kisi ki life dekh ke lagta hai main bahut behind hoon. Har roz Instagram pe dekh raha hoon ki log kitne travel kar rahe hain, kitni achhi jobs hain. Apni life mein khushi nahi aati.
Har kisi se compare karna aur khud mein khushi nahi aati - yaar yeh painful hai. Phone band karke yeh feelings aati hain ya mainly Instagram pe hone pe?
Mainly Instagram pe. Jab phone band hota hoon toh thoda better feel hota hoon. Par phir seedha Instagram kholne ka mann karta hai again. Cycle hai yaar.

Dekh yaar - phone band hone pe better feel hota hai, aur khulne pe cycle shuru ho jaata hai - woh bata deta hai ki Instagram hi tumhe actually hurt kar raha hai. Woh log curated version dikha rahe hain - real life nahi. Tumhara dimag unki highlight reel vs tumhari actual daily life compare kar raha hai - woh fair comparison kabhi nahi hai. Instagram 3 din ke liye delete karo yaar, seriously. Dekho kitna difference aata hai.
Roz raat ko 2-3 pegs peeta hoon. Pehle sirf weekends pe tha. Ab weekdays mein bhi ho jaata hai. Agar na piyu toh raat bhar uncomfortable rehta hoon aur neend bilkul nahi aati.
Weekends se weekdays tak aur bina iske neend nahi aati - yaar body ne depend kar liya hai isse. Pehle se kitna zyada ho gaya hai amount mein?
Pehle ek peg tha, ab 2-3 ho gaye hain. Bina iske neend nahi aati aur subah uthke bhi thoda anxious feel hota hoon. Dost ne bhi baar baar bola hai par main ignore karta hoon.

Yaar subah anxious feel hona aur raat bhar neend na aana bina iske - woh withdrawal signs hain. Body ab chemically dependent hai yaar. Dost ne bhi baar baar bola hai - woh dekh rahe hain kya ho raha hai bahar se. Yeh serious hai - doctor ko honestly batao sab kuch. Akele band karna is stage pe safe nahi hai yaar, please.
I got into TikTok about 6 months ago and now I spend like 4-5 hours a day on it. I don't even remember picking up my phone sometimes - I just look up and 2 hours have passed.
2 hours disappearing without you realizing - that's your brain fully checked out bro. Did it jump to 4-5 hours fast or was it gradual?
Super fast actually. First week was maybe 30 min. Within a month it was hours. The algorithm just keeps feeding exactly what I want to see. I can't scroll away from it.

TikTok's algorithm is literally one of the most addictive things ever built bro - it learns your brain faster than any other app. 30 min to hours in a month is textbook. Time disappearing means dopamine loop is running on autopilot. Delete the app yaar - not hide, delete. Instagram and YouTube will still scratch that itch but TikTok specifically is designed to be impossible to put down. It needs to go.

Yaar main roz gym jaata hoon par gym ke alawa bhi protein shakes, supplements aur vitamins itne le raha hoon ki body zyada supplements pe depend ho gaya hai. Doctor ne bola hai reduce karo but band nahi ho raha.
Doctor ne bola hai reduce karo par band nahi ho raha - yaar doctor ne specifically kya kaha hai?
Bola hai ki itne supplements dangerous hain long term ke liye aur kidneys pe pressure hai. Par main sochta hoon bina iske results nahi aayenge. Bahut invested ho gaya hoon isme yaar.

Yaar doctor ne kidneys pe pressure bola hai aur phir bhi continue kar rahe ho - woh serious health warning hai. 'Bina iske results nahi aayenge' yeh woh belief hai jo supplement industry ne banaya hai, reality nahi hai. Body agar already depend ho gaya hai toh gradually reduce karna padega - but doctor ki guidance mein karo, apne hisaab se nahi. Health damage long term ho sakta hai yaar, results baad mein aa sakte hain.
I play online poker almost every night now. Started as fun with friends but now I'm playing alone for hours. I've lost quite a bit of money but I keep thinking the next hand will make it all back.
Playing alone for hours and 'next hand will fix it' thinking - that's a red flag bro. How much has gone so far roughly?
Around 40k over 3 months. I haven't told anyone. I took some from my emergency savings. I know it's bad but in the moment I can't stop myself.

Bro, 40k in 3 months, emergency savings gone, hiding it from everyone - this is gambling addiction, straight up. 'Can't stop in the moment' is exactly what addiction feels like. The math never works in your favor long run yaar - house always wins. You need to tell someone you trust about this, and seriously look into support resources. This is too big to handle alone.

Yaar mujhe pata hai ki bahut zyada phone use ho raha hai but main specifically ek cheez notice karta hoon - jab bhi koi bura feel hota hoon ya anxious hoti hoon toh seedha phone haath mein aa jaata hai. Bina sooche.
Bura feel hona aur seedha phone haath mein - woh automatic escape hai yaar. Kaun si feelings hain jinke upon yeh sabse zyada hota hai?
Mostly loneliness aur jab ghar pe boring feel hota hoon. Akela baithna mushkil hai. Phone pe koi bhi content chalega - bas woh feeling hatani hai.

Yaar loneliness feel karna toh naturally uncomfortable hai par phone woh loneliness actually solve nahi karta - sirf temporarily band kar deta hai. Woh feeling wapas aayi rehti hai jab phone band hota hai isliye zyada zyada phone pe depend hota jaata hai. Ek din try karo - akele baithke, bina screen ke, just 20 min. Uncomfortable hoga - woh okay hai. But agar consistently yeh loneliness hai toh kisi dost se actually baat karo in person yaar.

Yaar raat tak jaag ke kahani likhta hoon ya k-drama dekh raha hoon aur subah 7 baje office jaata hoon. 2-3 ghante neend milti hai. Uska bina kaam karna mushkil hai but yeh routine band nahi kar sakta.
2-3 ghante neend aur phir bhi band nahi kar saka - yaar body kaise chal raha hai aur neend band hone pe kya feel hota hai?
Bahut tired rehta hoon poora din. Coffee pe survive karta hoon. Par raat ko wahi cycle - mujhe lagta hai ki yeh meri productive time hai aur yahi mera 'me time' hai. Subah uthna nahi chahta kabhi.

Yaar 'me time' woh hai na lekin 2-3 ghante neend pe chal raha hai body - that's not sustainable at all. Coffee pe din survive karna, subah uthna nahi chahna - yeh cycle tumhe slowly damage kar raha hai. Real me time woh hai jab body healthy ho. Ek week try karo 11 baje so jaao - dekho kitna better subah feel hota hai yaar.
I've been doom scrolling Twitter for the past year. Like literally hours just reading arguments, controversial takes, drama. I feel angry and stressed after but I just keep going back.
Hours of arguments and drama, feeling angry after but going right back - why do you think you keep returning if it makes you feel bad?
Honestly I think it makes me feel smart? Like I'm watching people argue and I'm judging them. And sometimes I get angry which feels like... something? My life is pretty boring otherwise.

That makes sense actually bro - feeling 'smart' and getting emotional responses fills a gap when life feels boring. But here's the thing - that anger and stress is real, it's affecting your mood every single day. Twitter is literally designed to trigger emotional reactions to keep you scrolling. The 'something' feeling it gives you is just dopamine from outrage. Log off for a week yaar, genuinely. See what your mood looks like without that constant input.

Yaar mujhe pata hai ki kaafi zyada ho raha hai but har raat tak jaag ke kuch na kuch khaata rehta hoon. Subah uthke guilt hota hai. Lekin raat aati hai toh wahi hota hai - fridge mein jaata hoon automatically.
Raat ko automatic fridge pe jaana aur subah guilt - yaar yeh pattern kabse shuru hua aur raat ko specifically kya trigger hota hai?

Mostly jab stress hota hai ya akela feel hota hoon. Din bhar sab theek rahta hoon but raat ko woh sab feelings surface pe aati hain aur khana hi ek cheez hai jo toot momentarily better feel karata hai.

Yaar raat ko stress aur loneliness surface pe aata hai - woh real feelings hain aur brain ne find out kiya hai ki khana temporarily woh feelings daba deta hai. But woh fix nahi hai - guilt subah aa jaata hai aur cycle repeat hota hai. Ek kaam karo - raat ko jab woh feeling aaye, pehle 10 min baith ke dekho ki actually kya feel ho raha hai. Sometimes just naming the feeling - 'lonely hoon' - before reaching for food, breaks the auto-pilot yaar.

Yaar main har subah uthke seedha news check karta hoon - newspapers, TV, apps - ek ghanta tak. Din bhar bhi updates check karta rehta hoon. Kisi bhi cheez pe focus nahi lagta jab tak latest news nahi padh loo.
Focus nahi lagta jab tak latest news nahi padh loo - matlab brain ko har baar update chahiye hota hai. Kaunsi news zyada pull karti hai tumhe?
Mostly politics aur international conflicts. Lagta hai ki agar nahi padha toh kuch important miss ho jaayega. Aur honestly thoda anxious feel hota hoon jab phone pe news nahi check kar sakta.

Yaar 'important miss ho jaayega' woh FOMO hai - reality mein ek ghanta ka gap rakhne se koi bhi important cheez nahi miss hoti. Aur anxiety without checking - that means it's not just reading anymore, it's a dependency. News apps specifically designed hain to keep pulling you back. Phone pe news notifications off karo yaar - ek specific time rakhte ho din mein 15 min ke liye poora update padho. Rest of the day free rakhte ho us cycle se.

I literally can't watch anything without subtitles anymore. Started with Korean dramas and now even English shows I need subtitles. I've watched like 30 shows this year alone. I binge 4-5 episodes every single night without fail.
30 shows this year and 4-5 episodes every night - that's a serious amount of screen time bro. What happens if you don't watch one night?

I genuinely feel restless and can't fall asleep. It's like my brain needs that stimulation to shut down. I tried reading a book instead last week but gave up after 10 minutes - felt so boring compared to watching.

Your brain literally can't wind down without a show now - that's what heavy binging does, it raises the stimulation threshold so everything else feels boring by comparison. Reading feels slow because your brain is used to constant visual dopamine. The restlessness without it is real bro. Try this - watch only one episode, then just lie in the dark. It'll feel uncomfortable at first but your brain will adjust faster than you think yaar. It's just been trained wrong.

Yaar main har roz apne body pe itna focused hoon - mirror dekh raha hoon, photos le raha hoon, gym mein har exercise ke baad check karta hoon. Agar ek din gym miss ho jaata hai toh pura din anxious rehta hoon.
Har exercise ke baad mirror check karna aur ek din miss hone pe anxiety - yaar yeh obsession hai body ke saath. Kab se itna intense hua hai?
Kaafi time se. Pehle bas fit rehna chahta tha but ab lagta hai ki agar perfect nahi hoon toh main worthless hoon. Dost ne bola hai ki main thoda zyada obsessed ho gaya hoon isme.

Yaar 'perfect nahi toh worthless' - woh belief dangerous hai. Tumhari worth gym se nahi aati. Dost ne bola hai, aur khud bhi feel kar rahe ho ki kuch off hai - woh gut feeling sahi hai. Ek din gym ke bina dekho - intentionally. Dekho kaun sa emotion surface pe aata hai jab body reflect nahi hota tumhari identity mein. Yeh conversation kisi professional se worth hai yaar, seriously.
Yaar main roz raat ko Snapchat pe ghanton tak spend karta hoon. Dost log stories dekh raha hoon, messages kar raha hoon. Subah uthke thaka hua feel hota hoon but raat ko phir wahi hota hai.
Raat bhar Snapchat aur subah thaka hua - yaar Snapchat pe itna pull kyun hota hai raat ko, kya lagta hai?
Lagta hai ki din bhar sab kuch hota hai aur raat ko bas akela hoon toh dost ke saath connected feel karna chahta hoon. Aur kabhi kabhi andar se bora feel hota hoon toh Snap hi ek option hai.

Yaar woh akela feel karna aur din bhar ki thakan ke baad kisi se connected rehna chahna - woh bilkul real hai. Par ek baat notice karo na - raat bhar Snap pe rehke actually connected feel hota hai ya sirf waqt jaata hai? Kyunki agar subah thaka hua uthte ho toh body ko rest de raha hai nahi clearly. Shayad kisi ek dost ko call karo briefly before bed - real connection thoda zyada satisfying hota hai aur neend bhi better aati hai.
I started journaling to deal with my anxiety but now I spend 3-4 hours a day writing. I can't stop once I start. It's supposed to help but I feel more stuck in my own head now.
That's interesting - you started it to feel better but now it's making you feel more stuck. What does it feel like when you're deep into writing?

It's like I keep going in circles. I write the same worries over and over. And honestly it feels like the only time I process anything, so I can't quit it either. It's become the only thing that makes me feel in control.

Going in circles with the same worries and it being the only thing that feels like control - that's a heavy weight to carry bro. The thing is, journaling is good but when it becomes the only way you process stuff, it starts trapping you in the loop instead of helping you move through it. Maybe try writing for 30 min max and then do something physical after - walk, stretch, anything. Get out of your head into your body for a bit. That shift might actually help more than another hour on paper.
Yaar mujhe pata hai ki mujhe apne phone band karna chahiye but jab bhi akela hota hoon toh seedha Google pe random cheezein search karta hoon - recipe, history, celebrities - kuch bhi. Ghanton tak.
Kuch bhi search karte ho - matlab content matter nahi karta, bas searching itself chal raha hota hai. Akele hone pe yeh itna automatic hai?
Haan bilkul. Pata nahi kab haath phone mein aa jaata hai. Aur honestly jab search band karta hoon toh ek tarah ki emptiness feel hoti hai - jaise dimag ko kuch karna hai constantly.

Woh emptiness feel karna - yaar woh uncomfortable hai, aur brain naturally us feeling se bachna chahta hai. Isliye search ek easy escape ban gaya hai. Par woh emptiness actually itni buri nahi hai jitni lagti hai - bas unfamiliar hai. Ek din try karo ki jab woh feeling aaye toh bas baithke feel karo 5-10 min bina phone ke. Dekho kya aata hai andar se. Shayad kuch real samajh aata hai.
Every time I fight with my girlfriend, I end up buying something online. Amazon, Flipkart - doesn't matter. I spend like 5-6k in one night just to calm down. Next morning I feel stupid.
5-6k in one night after a fight and feeling stupid next morning - that sounds really draining bro. What's going on in your head right after the argument, before you start buying?

I feel so powerless in those fights. She doesn't listen, I can't control the situation. So buying stuff feels like the one thing I can actually decide on my own. It gives me that 2 minutes of feeling okay.

That feeling of powerlessness after a fight - yaar that's really painful, and it makes total sense you'd want something that feels like it's in your control. But that 2 minutes of okay comes with regret every single time, so it's not actually helping you feel better. The real issue is that fight and how helpless it makes you feel. Maybe next time instead of opening Amazon, just step outside for 10 min or text someone - let that anger breathe first before acting on it.
Yaar main har roz apne Instagram followers count dekh raha hoon. Har post ke baad continuously check karta hoon ki kitne likes aaye. Agar kam aaye toh poora din sad rehta hoon.
Poora din sad rehna kam likes pe - yaar woh ek number hai aur itna affect kar raha hai mood ko. Kab se hai ki likes aur followers itna zyada matter karte hain?
Jab se Instagram serious use karna shuru kiya tab se. Honestly lagta hai ki agar log like nahi karte toh matlab mujhe log pasand nahi karte. Woh validation hai na jo mujhe bahar se milta hai.

Yaar woh validation ki zaroorat - bilkul samajh mein aati hai, koi bhi chahta hai ki log unhe notice karein. Lekin yeh thoda heavy hai ki poora din ka mood ek number pe depend ho raha hai. Woh likes actually tujhe batate nahi ki log tujhe kitna jaante hain ya value karte hain - bas ek button press hai. Real validation woh hai jo close people dete hain in life. Shayad ek experiment karo - ek din post karo aur notifications off kar do, dekho kaisa feel hota hai bina check kiye.
Yaar main har roz multiple dating apps use karta hoon - Hinge, Bumble, Tinder - ek saath. Ghanton tak swipe karta rehta hoon. Kabhi match hua bhi toh conversation nahi aage badhta kabhi.
Teeno apps ek saath, ghanton tak swiping, aur conversations nahi move hoti - yaar frustrated feel hota hai isme itna time lagaate hue?
Bahut frustrated hai yaar. Par band nahi kar sakta kyunki lagta hai ki agar band kiya toh kabhi milega nahi koi. Aur honestly ek tarah ka hope hai ki 'agle swipe mein milega' - wahi chalta rehta hai.

Woh frustration aur fir bhi 'agle swipe mein milega' wala hope - yaar woh ek painful loop hai. Itna time lagaana aur kuch nahi milna - woh actually confidence pe bhi hit karti hai na? Ek suggestion hai - ek hafte ke liye sab apps delete karo. Ek. In that time try to go out more, real people milne de naturally. Sometimes real connections happen when you stop manufacturing them. And honestly yeh apps specifically designed hain to keep you swiping - it's not a you problem.

I've been taking melatonin every night for over a year now. Started because I couldn't sleep after a stressful period. Now even if I'm tired I can't fall asleep without it. I don't want to be on it forever.

A year on melatonin and now sleep won't come without it - that's frustrating, especially when you know you don't want to depend on it. Do you remember what the sleep was like before you started taking it?

Before it was actually okay most nights. I think I just got so used to the routine of taking it that now my brain expects it. Like it's become part of the ritual and without it something feels missing.

That ritual feeling - your brain literally learned that sleep comes after the pill, so now it waits for that signal. It's not that you can't sleep without it, it's that your brain just hasn't gotten the signal to shut down. The good news is that's actually changeable bro. Talk to your doctor about tapering off slowly - don't just stop cold. And start building a new wind-down ritual - same time, dim lights, no screens - give your brain a new signal to latch onto.
Yaar main har roz subah uthke seedha YouTube pe tutorial dekh raha hoon - coding, cooking, fitness - sab kuch. 3-4 ghante tak. Par actually koi bhi cheez try nahi karta kabhi.
Itne saare tutorials dekh raha hai but koi cheez actually try nahi karti - yaar kabhi frustration feel hua hai ki 'dek raha hoon lekin kar nahi raha'?

Haan yaar. Lagta hai ki dekh liya toh kaam kar liya jaise. Ek tarah ka productive feel aata hai bina actually kuch kiye. Par andar se pata hai ki kuch nahi hua. Aur woh productive feeling addictive hai.

Woh productive feeling bina kiye - yaar woh interesting hai actually. Brain ko lagta hai ki learning ho rahi hai because watching feels like doing. Aur woh comfortable hai kyunki actually karne mein risk hai - kya agar galat ho? Watching mein woh risk nahi hai. Par real satisfaction tab milti hai jab actually kuch banata hai ya karta hai toh. Ek small step lo yaar - aaj ek tutorial dekho aur sirf ek cheez try karo usemein - even if it fails. Dekho woh feel kaisa hai.
I have been using nicotine pouches for 6 months now. Started because I wanted to quit cigarettes. But honestly I think I just switched one addiction to another. I use 8-10 pouches a day.
8-10 pouches a day and you already feel like it's just swapping one thing for another - that self-awareness is real bro. How does your body feel with that much nicotine through the day?
Honestly not great. My gums are getting sore, I feel jittery sometimes. But the moment I don't have one in, I feel irritable and restless within an hour. I can't focus on anything without it.

Gums sore, jittery, and irritable within an hour without it - yaar your body is already telling you it doesn't like this much nicotine. You did the brave thing quitting cigarettes so you know you can handle discomfort. But this amount is too high to just push through alone. This one I'd genuinely suggest talking to a doctor about - they can help you step down gradually in a way that's actually manageable. You don't have to white-knuckle it.

Yaar main har roz apne ex ki social media dekh raha hoon. Unke photos, stories, new posts - sab dekh raha hoon. Pata hai nahi karni chahiye lekin automatically kholti hoon app aur seedha unka profile.
Automatically unka profile - matlab conscious decision nahi hai, bas ho jaata hai. Yaar woh dekh ke kaisa feel hota hai honestly?
Bahut painful hai yaar. Kabhi kabhi lagta hai ki woh khush hai bina mere - woh hurt karta hai. Lekin band nahi kar sakti kyunki agar nahi dekha toh lagta hai ki completely forget ho jaaunga unhe.

Woh hurt feel karna aur phir bhi dekh raha hoon - yaar woh really tough hai. Aur woh fear ki 'forget ho jaaunga' - actually dheere dheere forgetting toh natural process hai, painful nahi. Par roz dekh ke tum khud apne andar wound ko fresh rakh rahe ho. Ek step lo - unhe block mat karo, bas app se apna access hatao for a few weeks. Unhe forget nahi karoge, bas apne andar healing ka time doge.

Yaar mujhe ek cheez batani hai - main har roz gym jaata hoon lekin recently injury hui thi toh 2 hafte band raha. Woh 2 hafte mujhe itne anxious kiye ki neend nahi aati thi. Kuch bhi feel karta tha na body mein toh lagta tha ki permanently damage ho gaya hai.
2 hafte mein itna anxious, neend nahi, har cheez mein damage dekh raha hai - yaar woh 2 hafte actually bahut stressful lage honge. Gym se pehle kabhi aisa anxiety feel hua tha kabhi?

Nahi yaar. Pehle gym sirf healthy rehne ke liye tha. Par ab lagta hai ki agar nahi gaya toh main kuch nahi hoon. Identity zyada tied ho gaya hai isme. Aur ab wapas gaya hoon toh relief hai but woh fear abhi bhi hai ki agar phir band hua toh.

Yaar 'agar nahi gaya toh main kuch nahi hoon' - woh feeling itni heavy hai. Aur woh wapas aane pe bhi fear abhi hai - matlab body at peace nahi hai. Gym tumhara ek part hai but tum sirf gym nahi ho. Woh anxiety itni intense thi 2 hafte mein - honestly yaar kabhi kisi therapist se baat karo iske baare mein, sirf yeh samajhne ke liye ki yeh fear kahan se aa raha hai. Woh ek conversation worth hai.

I have been watching true crime documentaries every single night for the past 8 months. Like 3-4 hours straight. I know it's dark but I genuinely can't fall asleep without watching something like that.
True crime specifically, every night, 3-4 hours - and it's become a sleep ritual now. Does it actually relax you or is it more like your brain just needs something to focus on?
Honestly it's the focus thing. My mind gets really loud when it's quiet. True crime is intense enough that it drowns everything else out. Without it I'd just lie there thinking about all my problems.

That loud mind when it gets quiet - yaar that's really uncomfortable and I totally get why you'd want something to drown it out. But true crime is actually stimulating your brain right before sleep, which means you're not getting real rest even when you're dozing off. The problems aren't going away just because you're not thinking about them. Maybe start with just one episode instead of 3-4 and see what that loud mind is actually saying - sometimes it's trying to tell you something that needs attention.

Yaar main har roz apne phone pe alarms set karta hoon but fir bhi neend zyada hoti hai. 12-13 ghante so jaata hoon. Office se late aata hoon. Maa bhi frustrated hain. Par uthna mushkil lagta hai subah ko.
12-13 ghante so raha hai aur phir bhi uthna mushkil hai - yaar woh sirf neend nahi lagta, body actually bahut drained hai shayad. Raat ko kitne baje so jaata hai usually?
Raat ko 2-3 baje tak jaag raha hoon usually. Phone dekh raha hoon mostly. Aur subah uthke itna heavy feel hota hoon ki lagta hai soona hi ek option hai. Actually kaam pe jaana exhausting lagta hai.

Raat 2-3 baje tak jaagna, subah heavy feel karna, aur kaam pe jaana exhausting lagna - yaar woh sirf neend ka problem nahi hai. Andar se kuch bahut heavy chal raha hai jo body ko itna drain kar raha hai. Kabhi kisi close person se baat karne ka mann kiya iske baare mein?

I started microdosing psychedelics about 4 months ago. Initially felt amazing - so clear headed. Now I feel like I need it every other day just to feel normal. Without it everything feels grey and flat.
Started feeling amazing and now without it everything feels grey - that shift is a big one bro. When you say 'normal', what does normal feel like for you on a regular day without it?

Honestly pretty empty. Like I go through the day but nothing really hits me. I think that emptiness was there before I started too, the microdosing just masked it. Now I can feel it even more when it wears off.

Yaar that emptiness being there before too - that's actually really honest of you to see that. The microdosing didn't create the problem, it just made it louder when it stopped. But relying on it every other day to feel anything is not a solution bro, it's just covering the same wound. This one needs a real conversation - with a doctor or therapist who actually knows about this stuff. Not to judge, just to help you figure out what that emptiness is actually about.

Yaar mujhe ek problem hai - main har kisi ke saath comparing karta hoon khud ko. College mein topper tha, ab job mein lag gaya hoon to colleagues se compare karta hoon. LinkedIn dekh ke lagta hai ki sab aage nikal gaye hain. Roz ek baar check karta hoon apna profile vs unka.
Roz LinkedIn pe compare - yaar woh ek baar check karne ke baad sad feel hota hai ya motivation milti hai?

Mostly sad aur frustrated yaar. Lagta hai ki main behind hoon. Aur phir raat tak woh same thought ghoomta rehta hai ki 'kyun nahi mein wahan hoon'. Sleep bhi disturb hoti hai kabhi kabhi iske wajah se.

Raat tak woh thought ghoomta hai aur neend disturb hoti hai - yaar woh actually bahut heavy hai andar. Woh frustration bilkul samajh mein aati hai. Par LinkedIn pe everyone highlight reel show karta hai - failures, struggles koi nahi dikhata wahan. Tum apni actual daily life vs unki curated story compare kar rahe ho - woh kabhi fair comparison nahi hogi. LinkedIn thodi der ke liye hatao - sirf ek hafte ke liye. Dekho kitna light feel hota hai dimag mein.

Yaar main har roz ek dost ke saath voice notes exchange karta hoon - 10-15 voice notes ek din mein, kabhi kabhi 20 tak bhi. Poori raat tak chal raha hota hai. Agar woh respond nahi karta toh anxious ho jaata hoon.
20 tak voice notes aur respond nahi karne pe anxiety - yaar woh dost ke saath connection bahut important hai tumhare liye clearly. Aur jab woh respond nahi karta toh exactly kya feel hota hai?

Lagta hai ki shayad mujhe ignore kar raha hai ya mujhe paas nahi chahiye woh. Bahut insecure ho jaata hoon. Aur honestly woh ek hi person hai jinse main comfortable feel karta hoon, baaki duniya se thoda detached feel hota hoon.

Ek hi person pe itna dependent feel karna aur baaki duniya se detached - yaar woh lonely feeling andar hai clearly. Aur woh insecurity jab woh respond nahi karta - woh actually friendship ke baare mein nahi hai, woh tumhari worth ke baare mein hai jo tumhe feel ho raha hai. Koi ek insaan poori emotional need fulfill nahi kar sakta bina burden feel kiye. Shayad kabhi kabhi kisi aur se bhi thodi baat karo - even small conversations, dheere dheere.
I have been pulling my hair out when I'm stressed for like 2 years now. It happens mostly at night when I'm studying or working late. I don't even realize I'm doing it until my scalp hurts.
You don't even realize you're doing it - that's how deep the stress response has gone bro. When you notice it afterwards, how do you feel about it?

Honestly ashamed. I've been hiding it from everyone - wearing caps, styling my hair to cover the patches. It feels like something is really wrong with me. But the stress just keeps coming and my hands just go there automatically.

Yaar hiding it from everyone and feeling ashamed on top of the stress - that's a lot to carry alone. There's actually nothing 'wrong' with you - this is your body's way of dealing with intense stress and it's more common than you think. But it's hurting you physically and the shame is making it worse. This is genuinely one of those things where talking to a professional can actually make a huge difference - not because you're broken, but because you deserve to not be carrying this by yourself.

Yaar main har roz subah uthke seedha Quora padhta hoon. Answers padhta rehta hoon ghanton tak. Din bhar kaafi energized feel hota hoon - jaise kuch naya sikha. But actually kuch remember nahi hota dono ghante baad.
Energized feel hota hai but kuch remember nahi hota - yaar woh interesting hai. Woh energy real feel hoti hai na padhte waqt?
Haan bilkul real lagti hai. Jaise main wise ho raha hoon. Par raat ko bed pe jab sochta hoon ki aaj kya seekha - blank hai dimag. Aur woh realization tab aata hai ki time bhi gaya aur kuch nahi mila.

Woh wise feel hona aur phir raat ko blank - yaar woh frustrating hogi realization. Brain ko padhte waqt ek type ka satisfaction milta hai jo bilkul real feel hota hai, but retain nahi hota because actually process nahi ho raha. Haan try karo ek change - padhte waqt ek line note karo phone pe - just ek meaningful line. Sirf woh ek line. Agar woh bhi nahi bachti toh honestly Quora time thoda cut back karna worth hai.

I have been playing mobile games - mostly gacha games - for about a year. I spend real money on them too. Around 15-20k a month. My friends think I'm wasting money but honestly it's the only time I feel genuinely happy.
The only time you genuinely feel happy - that's important bro. What is it about playing that actually makes you feel that way?
It's like an escape. Real life feels heavy - work pressure, family stuff. In the game I have full control, I can achieve things, I feel strong. Nobody judges me there. It's peaceful honestly.

That peace and feeling strong where nobody judges you - yaar that sounds like something you really need and deserve to feel. The thing is though, 15-20k a month is a lot of real money going into something where that feeling only lasts while you're logged in. And outside of it, everything still feels heavy. The game is giving you relief, not solving anything underneath. Maybe think about what makes real life feel so heavy right now - that's the actual thing worth addressing. The game can stay as fun, but it shouldn't be the only place you feel okay.

Yaar main har roz office mein lunch break mein bahar nahi jaata. Desk pe baith ke YouTube ya Instagram dekh raha hoon poora break. Ghar aake bhi screen pe hoon. Actually kabhi bhi fresh air nahi lete kabhi.
Kabhi fresh air nahi lete - yaar din bhar screen pe rehne ke baad actually kaisa feel hota hai body ko?

Haan bahut drained aati hai shaam tak. Headache bhi hoti hai. Par lunch break mein bahar jaana - pata nahi, laziness hai ya kuch aur - actually feel hota hai ki bahar jaana effort hai. Screen pe karna easy hai.

Woh 'bahar jaana effort hai' feeling - yaar woh actually laziness nahi hai. Body itni drained hai screens se ki even moving feels like too much. Ek choti si cheez try karo - sirf lunch break mein 10 min bahar jaao, bina phone ke. Bas baithke ya walk karo. Dekho kaisa feel hota hai shaam tak compared to aaj. Honestly fresh air aur natural light mind ko zyada reset karte hain than any break on screen.
Yaar mujhe ek cheez bolni hai - main roz raat ko Instagram reels dekh raha hoon 2-3 ghante tak. Pata hai ki zyada hai but band nahi ho raha.
2-3 ghante roz aur band nahi ho raha - yaar raat ko specifically itna pull kyun hota hai iska?
Lagta hai ki din bhar itna busy rehta hoon ki raat ko sirf yahi time hai apne liye. Aur honestly thoda numb feel hota hoon raat ko - reels se woh numbness thoda kam hoti hai.
Woh numbness raat ko - yaar woh actually interesting hai ki din bhar busy rehne ke baad bhi andar se kuch heavy feel hota hai. Woh numbness kahan se aa raha hai lagta hai?
Sach mein pata nahi yaar. Shayad lonely feel hota hoon despite busy schedule. Ghar pe sab apne apne phones pe hain, office mein sab professional hai. Kisi se actually connect nahi feel hota kabhi.

Yaar woh loneliness itni deep hai - surrounded by people but actually connected feel nahi karna. Woh really painful hai aur Reels woh gap temporarily fill kar deta hai but actually woh connection nahi hai. Shayad ek cheez try karo - ek din kisi ek insaan se genuinely baat karo - not scrolling together, actually baat - dekho kaisa feel hota hai. Woh connection jo missing hai, woh phone se nahi aayega.
I've been drinking energy drinks every single day for about 8 months. Like 2-3 cans a day. My heart sometimes races but I keep going because without it I can't function at work.
Heart racing and still continuing - that's your body sending signals bro. What does 'can't function' actually look like at work without them?
I just crash completely. Like brain fog, can't focus, everything feels slow. I think it started because I was pulling late nights for a project and never stopped after that.

So the late nights started it and now your baseline is just... crash without it. That means your body reset its normal energy level around the caffeine. What are those late nights like now - is the project still going or is it something else keeping you up?

The project ended months ago honestly. I think I just got scared that if I'm not always productive I'll fall behind. Like rest feels like falling behind to me. And I genuinely don't know how to just... not be running at max speed.

Bro that fear - rest feeling like falling behind - that's heavier than the energy drinks themselves. The cans are just the tool you picked to keep running from that fear. And your body is already paying for it with the heart racing. You don't actually need to run at max speed - that belief is what's trapping you. Talk to a doctor about stepping down the caffeine safely first, and honestly that fear of slowing down is worth exploring with someone too. You deserve to actually rest without it feeling like losing.
Yaar main har raat tak jaag ke kuch na kuch khaata rehta hoon - biscuits, chips, sabka ghar se sab kuch. Subah uthke pet bhari hoti hai aur guilt hota hai.
Raat tak jaagna aur khaana aur subah guilt - yaar raat ko specifically kaun si time pe haath khana ki taraf jaata hai?
Mostly 11 baje ke baad. Din bhar sab theek rehta hoon. Par raat ko akela baithte hue lag jaata hai ki kuch missing hai. Aur khana hi ek comfort hai jo immediately better feel karata hai.
Woh 'something missing' feeling raat ko - yaar woh sirf bhook nahi hai clearly. Din bhar sab theek rehta hai but raat ko woh feeling aati hai - kya lagta hai ki kya missing hai?

Honestly yaar... lagta hai ki apni life mein koi aise nahi hai jise main genuinely close feel karta hoon. Family hai but emotional closeness nahi hai. Friends hain but surface level hai sab. Raat ko woh void feel hota hai.

Yaar woh void - woh real hai. Aur khana temporarily woh void fill kar deta hai isliye raat ko automatically haath wahan jaata hai. Woh loneliness acknowledge karna important hai - tum actually kisi deep connection ki longing feel kar rahe ho. Khana band karna mushkil hai jab tak woh underlying need address nahi hui. Ek step lo - kisi ek insaan ko actually batao ki kaise feel ho raha hai - not surface, actually. Woh connection wahi hai jo tum actually dhundh rahe ho.

Yaar mujhe coding mein itna interest hai ki raat bhar code karta hoon - personal projects, YouTube tutorials follow karta hoon. Subah office ke liye uthna mushkil hai but office mein bhi kaam se zyada apne projects pe dhyan lagta hai.

Raat bhar code, subah mushkil, office mein bhi apne projects - yaar woh passion hai clearly. Par itna zyada ho raha hai ki baaki sab chhod raha hai. Personal projects mein specifically kya milta hai jo office nahi deta?

Andar se free feel hota hoon yaar. Office mein har kaam kisi aur ke orders pe hota hai - boss batata hai kya karna hai. Apne projects mein main decide karta hoon sab kuch. Woh control feel acha lagta hai.

Woh freedom aur control - yaar woh bilkul samajh mein aata hai ki woh feeling kitni valuable hai jab baaki life mein zyada control nahi hota. Office mein specifically woh lack of control bahut frustrating hai?

Bahut yaar. Honestly office mein feel hota hai ki main sirf ek number hoon - koi creative input nahi, koi ownership nahi. Aur ghar pe bhi parents ke baare mein kuch decisions nahi le sakta apne baare mein. Coding hi ek jagah hai jahan main actually myself feel karta hoon.

Yaar woh 'only place where I feel myself' - woh heavy hai. Number feel karna office mein, control nahi ghar pe - dono jagah identity feel nahi karna. Coding projects woh sahi feel dete hain but ek ek jagah pe poori identity rely karna risky hai. Neend bhi ja rahi hai iske wajah se. Ek thought - apne career mein actually creative work explore karo seriously - internship, freelance, kuch bhi - taaki woh feeling sirf raat ke projects tak limited na rahe. Tumhe woh feeling deserve hai during the day too.
I keep buying stuff on Amazon - random things I don't really need. It happens mostly when I'm bored or stressed. I've spent probably 30k this month alone on random stuff.
30k in one month on stuff you don't need - that's a lot bro. When you click buy, what's happening in your head at that exact moment?

There's like a brief rush - like I'm treating myself, solving a problem even if I don't have one. And it fills up time. Honestly half the packages I don't even open properly before the next one arrives.

Packages arriving before you even open the last one - so it's not even about the thing you're buying. It's the anticipation and the rush of the order itself. What's going on in your life that makes you need that rush so frequently?

Honestly everything feels so routine and predictable. Wake up, work, come home, repeat. Nothing exciting happens. Shopping is the only thing that breaks the monotony. Without it my days all feel exactly the same and kind of pointless.

That feeling of days being pointless and same - yaar that's not a shopping problem, that's a life feeling empty problem. The buying is just the quickest way to feel something different for a second. But it's not actually changing anything underneath. The real question is what would make your life feel less monotonous - not what can you buy to escape it. Even small things - one new thing a week that's actually an experience, not a purchase. A place, a person, anything. Your life needs more texture, not more packages.
Yaar main roz raat tak jaag ke phone dekh raha hoon - kabhi Instagram, kabhi YouTube, kabhi kuch bhi. Subah 6 baje alarm pe uthna impossible feel hota hai. Roz yahi hota hai.
Roz wahi cycle - raat tak jaagna, subah uthna mushkil - yaar phone pe jaag raha hai ya neend nahi aa rahi isliye phone pe jaata hai?
Honestly neend nahi aati first. Bahut zyada dimag mein chal raha hota hai raat ko - worry, future ke baare mein sochna, log kya sochte hain. Toh phone hai na - bas distraction hai iska.
Dimag mein bahut zyada chal raha hota hai - worry, future, log kya sochte hain. Yaar woh sab thoughts raat ko specifically aate hain ya din bhar bhi chal raha hota hai?

Din bhar bhi hai yaar but raat ko zyada intense hota hai kyunki akele hoon. Din mein kaam aur log distract kar dete hain but raat ko sirf main aur mere thoughts. Kabhi kabhi lagta hai ki main itna zyada sochta hoon ki brain kabhi rest nahi leta.

Yaar woh non-stop thinking - wo actually bahut exhausting hai. Brain kabhi rest nahi leta, aur raat ko akele ho ke woh zyada loud ho jaata hai. Phone is situation mein natural escape hai but woh thoughts band nahi karta, sirf temporarily daba deta hai. Yeh level ka anxiety - agar genuinely din bhar bhi chal raha hai - yaar ek professional se baat karne layak hai. Not because something is wrong with you, but because you deserve to not be trapped in your own head all day. Woh relief actually possible hai.
I watch porn every single day - sometimes multiple times. I know it's too much but I can't seem to stop. It's become automatic at this point.
Automatic at this point - so it's not even a conscious choice anymore bro. When did it shift from occasional to everyday?
Around when I moved to a new city alone. I didn't know anyone, nights were empty, and it was just... there. Easy access, instant gratification. Didn't have to deal with anything real.
Moving alone, empty nights, not knowing anyone - that's a lonely situation bro. And it was just the easiest thing to fill that space. Has the loneliness changed since then or is it still the same?

Still the same honestly. I have a few acquaintances now but nothing deep. I think I actually avoid real connections because porn gives me that feeling without the risk of rejection or vulnerability. It's safer.

Yaar that honesty - 'safer than risking real connection' - that's actually a really important thing to see. The porn isn't really about the content, it's about avoiding the scariest part of being human - actually letting someone in. And every day it stays, it makes real connection feel harder. This is one where I'd genuinely say talk to someone professional bro - not because you're doing something shameful, but because that fear of vulnerability deserves actual attention. You deserve a real connection, not just the safe version of it.
Yaar mujhe ek problem hai - main har roz apne phone mein apps check karta hoon 50 baar tak. Notifications pe seedha haath jaata hai. Koi bhi baar mein, kahi bhi.
50 baar tak - yaar woh automatic hai clearly, bina notification ke bhi check hota hai?

Dono yaar. Notification aaye ya na aaye, ek ek minute mein check hota hai. Aur honestly jab check karta hoon aur kuch nahi hota toh ek tarah ka disappointment feel hota hai - like kisi ne message nahi kiya matlab I don't matter.

Koi message nahi aaya matlab 'I don't matter' - yaar woh painful connection hai. Ek ek notification pe apni worth judge kar raha hai. Woh feeling kab se hai ki log respond nahi karte toh important nahi hai?

Bahut time se yaar. School mein bhi tha - group mein ignore hota tha sometimes. Tab se shayad yeh pattern hai ki validation bahar se milna chahiye. Aur ab phone hi sabse easy jagah hai jahan check kar sakta hoon ki log mujhe notice karte hain ya nahi.

Yaar school mein ignore hona - woh wound abhi bhi fresh hai under the surface. Aur phone har roz woh same wound check kar raha hai - are people noticing me? Har baar jab koi nahi noticing, woh same pain repeat hoti hai. Par yaar 50 times a day ek phone se validation milne wala nahi hai - woh kabhi enough nahi hoga. Woh need - actually noticed aur valued feel karna - woh real relationships se aata hai. Shayad kisi se - family, dost, therapist - in person woh baat karo ki how lonely feel hota hai. Woh phone se zyada kaam karega.
Yaar main har roz shaam ko ghar pe aakar seedha screen pe ho jaata hoon - TV, phone, laptop - kuch na kuch dekh raha hoon. Kabhi bina screen ke free time nahi bitiaya kabhi honestly.
Kabhi bina screen ke nahi - yaar screen hata dene pe uncomfortable feel hota hai?
Nahi yaar, try nahi kiya kabhi. Lagta hai ki bore ho jaaunga poori tarah. Aur honestly thoda dar lagta hai bina screen ke - like if I have nothing to watch or scroll, what do I even do with myself?

'What do I even do with myself' - yaar woh actually important question hai. Matlab apne aap ke saath without screen ke comfortable nahi feel karta. Yeh darr kahan se aa raha hai - kabhi aisa feel hua hai ki apne bare mein sochna uncomfortable hai?

Haan yaar actually. Jab quiet hota hoon toh bahut zyada apne baare mein sochne lag jaata hoon - past mistakes, future worries, self-criticism. Screen hai toh woh sab band ho jaata hai. Screen mujhe apne se bachne deta hai.

Yaar 'screen mujhe apne se bachne deta hai' - woh bahut honest observation hai. Past mistakes, future worries, self-criticism - woh sab andar hai aur screen se band kar raha hai apne aap ko. But jo andar hai woh jaata nahi - sirf quiet ho jaata hai. Woh self-criticism especially - woh deserve nahi karti itna. Ek din bina screen ke baithke dekho - even 30 min. Jo thoughts aayein, aane do. Agar woh self-criticism bahut zyada heavy ho toh yaar kisi se baat karna worth hai - woh voice andar hai jo tumhe hurt kar raha hai, aur tumhe help milne deserve hai uspe.
I've been skipping meals and then binge eating at night for about a year. During the day I barely eat - maybe one meal. Then at night I eat everything in sight until I feel sick.
Skipping all day and then everything at night until you're sick - bro that's a tough cycle. Is the skipping during the day intentional or do you just not feel hungry?

Bit of both actually. I'm so stressed during the day that eating feels like a waste of time. And there's this thing where I feel like I don't deserve to eat until I've been productive enough. Only at night I let go completely.
'Don't deserve to eat until productive enough' - bro that's a harsh thing to believe about yourself. Where does that feeling come from - like you have to earn basic things?

My dad honestly. Growing up he'd say things like 'you ate all day, what did you even do today?' So I think I internalized it. I feel guilty eating without doing enough. Night time is when I stop caring and just give in. But then the guilt comes back ten times worse.

Yaar your dad saying that - that stuck with you and became your own voice. The guilt, the 'earning' food, the cycle of denial and then giving in - that's not about food at all, that's about feeling like you're never enough. And that's really painful to carry. This one honestly deserves real support bro - a professional who understands eating patterns. Not because you're broken, but that voice saying you have to earn basic care? That needs to be challenged by someone qualified. You deserve to eat, full stop. No conditions.

Yaar main har roz subah uthke seedha WhatsApp groups check karta hoon - 10 se zyada groups hain. Din bhar bhi check karta rehta hoon. Agar kisi group mein miss ho jaata hoon toh feel hota hai ki important conversation miss ho gaya.
10 groups, din bhar check karna aur miss ho jaane ka darr - yaar actually sab groups mein participate karta hai ya sirf dekh raha hai?

Zyada dekh raha hoon honestly. Kabhi kabhi kuch type karta hoon but mostly sirf read karta hoon. Likha nahi isliye lagta hai ki outdated information hai apne paas. Par band nahi kar sakta kyunki lagta hai ki agar nahi dekha toh koi important cheez miss ho jaayegi.
Sirf dekh raha hai, participate nahi, but band nahi kar sakta - yaar woh 'miss ho jaayegi important cheez' wala darr - genuinely kya hua hai kabhi ki miss hone pe actually kuch bura hua?

Nahi yaar kabhi actually kuch bura nahi hua. Honestly lagta hai ki agar main nahi dekh raha toh main irrelevant hoon - like everyone will move on without me. Pichle life mein bahut baar such hua hai ki main left out tha aur woh feeling abhi bhi hai.

Yaar 'left out' wala feeling - woh bahut old pain hai aur WhatsApp groups har roz woh same fear trigger kar rahe hain. Kabhi actually kuch bura nahi hua miss hone pe but brain woh old feeling replay karta rehta hai. Groups ne tumhe actually connect nahi kiya - sirf anxious rakha hai. Ek hafte ke liye sab groups mute karo yaar - dekho ki actually koi important cheez miss hoti hai ya nahi. Aur woh left out feeling - woh real hai aur deserve karta hai ki kisi se actually baat karo about it.
I've been smoking cigarettes for 3 years now. Started in college to fit in with my friend group. Now I smoke like a pack a day and I genuinely need it to get through the day.
A pack a day and need it to get through - bro that's heavy dependence. You said you started to fit in - did that group pressure actually matter to you back then?
Yeah honestly it did. Everyone in my friend circle smoked and I wanted to belong. I was the new kid and smoking together was how we'd hang out. I didn't want to be the odd one out.
Wanting to belong and not be the odd one out - that's a really human thing bro. Did it actually help you feel like part of the group back then, or did it just give you something to do together?

Honestly just something to do together. I never actually felt fully included even then. I think I kept smoking because quitting would mean going back to being the outsider. And now I'm physically hooked too so it's both - the social thing and the nicotine. I don't even know which one is bigger.

Yaar never actually feeling included even then - so the cigarettes didn't actually solve the belonging problem, they just gave you a reason to stay in the circle. And now there's the physical addiction on top. Both need attention honestly. The nicotine part - talk to a doctor, there are real options to help with that. But the belonging part - that's bigger. You deserve to feel actually included somewhere, not just tolerated because you smoke together. That's worth finding - people where you don't have to do anything to belong.
Yaar mujhe pata hai ki bahut zyada ho raha hai but main har roz apne phone pe 6-7 ghante spend karta hoon. Mostly social media. Subah uthke pehli cheez phone hai, raat ko last cheez bhi phone hai.
Subah se raat tak phone - yaar iska 6-7 ghante mein kaun sa part sabse zyada draining feel hota hai?

Honestly sabse zyada draining Instagram hai. Har kisi ki life dekh ke lagta hai ki mere se sab better off hain. Meri apni life mein koi exciting nahi hai toh woh dekh raha hoon ki dusron ke kitni interesting hai.
Apni life mein koi exciting nahi hai isliye dusron ki dekh raha hoon - yaar woh longing feel hota hai. Kya actually life mein aisa hai jo tum chahte the but nahi hua?

Haan yaar. Main creative work karna chahta tha - photography, filmmaking. Par college mein parents ne bola ki impractical hai, stable job lo. Toh woh dream chhod diya. Ab Instagram pe creative people dekh raha hoon aur lagta hai ki woh meri wali life jeez rahe hain jo main jeena chahta tha.

Yaar woh dream chhodne ka pain - woh abhi bhi hai clearly. Instagram har roz woh same pain touch kar raha hai - 'woh wali life meri hoti jo main chahta tha.' Scrolling woh wound heal nahi kar raha, sirf repeat kar raha hai. Honestly yaar, woh creative interest abhi bhi hai tumhare andar - photography, anything. Sirf ek din try karo - phone rakh do, camera nikalо aur kuch capture karo. Ek chhoti si cheez. Dekho kaisa feel hota hai. Woh life abhi bhi possible hai, bas differently.
Yaar main har roz raat tak jaag ke kaam karta hoon - freelance projects. 1-2 baje tak. Subah 7 baje office jaata hoon. Body bahut tired hai but band nahi kar sakta.
Raat 1-2 baje tak freelance aur subah 7 pe office - yaar freelance band karne ka mann kyun nahi hota?

Kyunki office ki salary se guzara nahi hota yaar. Bahut zyada loan hai aur family pe bhi kuch responsibility hai. Toh raat ko freelance karna padta hai. Par ab itna thak gaya hoon ki dimag mein lagta hai ki kabhi end nahi aayega yeh cycle.

Loan, family responsibility, aur cycle ka end nahi - yaar woh pressure bahut heavy hai. Aur 'kabhi end nahi aayega' woh feeling - desperate hai woh. Kabhi lagta hai ki path out hai iska ya stuck feel hota hai completely?

Stuck yaar. Honestly sometimes lagta hai ki main trap mein hoon. Agar kaam band kiya toh bills nahi pay henge. Agar kaam karta rehta hoon toh health aur dimag dono toot jaayenge. Kabhi kabhi morning mein uthke sirf cry karta hoon before starting the day.

Yaar subah uthke cry karna - woh actually bahut serious sign hai ki andar se kab ka broken hai. Woh trap feel - loan, responsibility - woh real hai, haan. But body aur dimag toot raha hai aur woh zyada important hai. Yeh situation mein akele nahi reh sakte - please kisi trusted person ko batao sab kuch honestly. Aur loan situation ke baare mein ek baar financial advisor se baat karo - shayad koi option hai jo tumhe pata nahi. Right now sabse important hai ki tum okay raho.

I've been using Instagram filters on every single photo I post - heavy ones that change my skin, my face shape, everything. I can't post anything without editing it first. I spend an hour sometimes just on one photo.
An hour on one photo with heavy filters - bro what happens when you look at an unfiltered photo of yourself?

Honestly terrible. I hate how I look without them. Like the real me is somehow not good enough to be seen. I know it's social media pressure but I genuinely can't shake the feeling that I need to look a certain way to be worth posting.

'The real me is not good enough to be seen' - that's a really painful thing to feel bro. Is this just about posting online or does it go deeper than that - like how you feel about yourself in general?

It goes deeper honestly. Even in real life I avoid mirrors, I don't like photos taken of me without warning. My girlfriend has noticed and asked me about it. I think I just genuinely believe that I'm not attractive enough and never have been. Since like middle school actually.

Since middle school - yaar that's a really long time to carry that belief about yourself. The filters are just one way it shows up but the core thing is this deep belief that you're not enough as you are. That's not something Instagram created - it was there before. And it deserves real attention bro. Not just stopping the filters, but actually working through where that belief came from. Talk to someone about this - a therapist would actually help here. You deserve to be okay looking at yourself without filters.
Yaar main har roz subah uthke seedha news dekh raha hoon - TV, apps, newspapers. Ek ghante se zyada. Din bhar bhi updates check karta rehta hoon. Kisi cheez pe focus nahi lagta.
Ek ghante subah aur din bhar updates - yaar focus nahi lagta matlab brain ko constantly new information chahiye hota hai. Kaunsi news sabse zyada pull karti hai?

Mostly politics aur world conflicts. Lagta hai ki agar nahi padha toh kuch important miss ho jaayega. Aur honestly thoda anxious feel hota hoon jab news nahi dekh sakta - like something bad will happen and I won't know.

Anxious feel hota hai bina news ke - yaar woh sirf reading nahi hai toh. Woh anxiety - 'kuch bura hoga aur pata nahi hoga' - yeh feeling sirf news pe hai ya life mein generally bhi anxious feel hota hai?

Generally bhi yaar. Main zyada se zyada worry karta hoon - family ke baare mein, kaam, future. News actually ek tarah ka fuel hai uspe - dusre desh mein bura ho raha hai toh lagta hai ki anywhere bura ho sakta hai. Ek tarah ka safety nahi feel hota kabhi.

Yaar kabhi safety feel nahi hota - woh bahut tiring hai constantly. News woh fear ko feed kar raha hai - har nayi story 'duniya unsafe hai' prove karti hai dimag mein. Par honestly woh anxiety - family, kaam, future, safety - woh news se pehle tha. News sirf isme ek aur layer hai. Ek kaam karo - news notifications band karo, aur woh underlying anxiety ke baare mein kisi se actually baat karo. Doctor ya therapist. Woh general anxiety feel - uspe actually help milne deserving hai tum.

I started watching YouTube late at night because I couldn't sleep. Now it's been 6 months and every night is the same - 3-4 hours of random videos until 2-3 AM. I feel terrible in the morning but can't break the pattern.
6 months of the same pattern every night - bro the insomnia started it but something is keeping it going now. What was going on when the sleep problems first started?
That's when I broke up with my girlfriend actually. We were together for 2 years. After that breakup nights just became really empty and quiet and I couldn't handle just lying there with my thoughts.

The breakup made nights feel empty and your thoughts too loud - that makes a lot of sense actually bro. Has anything changed about how you feel about the breakup since then, or is it still affecting you?

Still affects me honestly. I think I watch videos just to not feel alone at night. The voices, the noise - it's like having someone there. Lying in silence and thinking about her and the relationship and what I did wrong - that's unbearable. YouTube is less painful than that.

Yaar 'less painful than thinking about her' - so you haven't actually moved through the breakup grief, you've just been avoiding it for 6 months with YouTube. That's understandable - breakup pain is real and heavy. But it's not going away, it's just staying there, and your sleep is gone because of it. Honestly bro, you need to actually feel this pain instead of running from it every night. Talk to someone about it - a friend, a therapist, anyone. The grief needs to come out, not be buried under hours of videos.
Yaar main har roz gym pe 2 ghante jaata hoon - weights, cardio, sab kuch. Agar ek din miss ho jaata hai toh poora din anxious rehta hoon. Body ache hota hai but next day phir jaata hoon.
Ek din miss hone pe poora din anxious - yaar woh sirf fit rehne ka desire nahi hai. Gym mein specifically kaisa feel hota hai andar?

Wahan feel hota hai ki main control mein hoon yaar. Baaki life mein bahut kuch hai jo control nahi hai - job insecurity, family pressure, relationships. But gym mein har rep, har set mera decision hai.

Control feel karna gym mein jabki baaki life mein sab chaotic hai - yaar woh actually makes total sense. Par woh anxiety jab miss hota hai - woh gym ke baare mein nahi, baaki life ka chaos hai jo surface pe aa raha hai. Job insecurity aur family pressure - woh kitne heavy hain actually?

Bahut heavy yaar. Job ka pata nahi kitne din raha - layoffs ho rahe hain company mein. Parents ko pata nahi ki meri situation kaisa hai, woh sochte hain sab theek hai. Akele carry kar raha hoon sab kuch. Gym hi ek jagah hai jahan thodi si peace milti hai.

Yaar akele sab kuch carry karna - job ka darr, parents ko sach nahi bata sakte - woh bahut heavy hai ek insaan ke liye. Gym woh single escape hai right now aur isliye miss hone pe itna anxious feel hota hai - kyunki woh single safe space hai. Par itna zyada rely karna ek cheez pe - woh dangerous hai. Parents ko honestly batao ki job situation kaisa hai - ek baar. Woh worry karenge shayad but akele carry karna worse hai. Tumhe kisi ka support chahiye yaar, sirf gym nahi.

I spend hours every day reading self-help books and watching motivational videos. Like genuinely 3-4 hours. I have a whole shelf of books. But honestly I don't think any of it has actually changed anything in my life.
3-4 hours daily and nothing has changed - bro that's a lot of time invested. What made you start getting into self-help in the first place?

I was going through a really rough patch - job loss, friends moving away. I felt like I was falling behind everyone. Self-help felt like the answer, like if I just learned enough I could fix everything.
'If I learn enough I can fix everything' - that's a lot of pressure to put on yourself bro. Has anything actually shifted from all that reading, even small things?

Not really. I think I keep reading because it feels productive without actually being productive. Like I'm doing something about my problems without actually facing them. It's comfortable - safer than actually trying to change things and risking failure.

Yaar 'safer than actually trying and risking failure' - that's really honest. The self-help became its own escape - feels like progress without the scary part. And underneath it all there's still that feeling of falling behind and being broken that started it. The books can't fix that because they can't do the actual scary part for you. Ek kaam karo - pick one small thing you've read about and actually do it this week. Just one. And that feeling of falling behind - that deserves a real conversation, not more books about it.
Yaar mujhe ek baat bolni hai - main har roz ghar pe baith ke khana khaati hoon aur saath mein poora meal mein phone pe scroll karti hoon. Kabhi bina phone ke khana nahi khaya kabhi.
Har meal mein phone pe - yaar kabhi bina phone ke khana khaiya hai?
Haan yaar honestly. Lagta hai ki bore ho jaaunga bina phone ke. Aur honestly thoda dar lagta hai - like if I have nothing to scroll, what do I even do with myself during meals.
'What do I even do with myself' - yaar woh actually important feeling hai. Matlab apne aap ke saath bina screen ke comfortable nahi feel karta during meals?

Haan yaar actually. Jab quiet hota hoon toh bahut zyada apne baare mein sochne lag jaata hoon - past mistakes, future worries. Phone hai toh woh sab band ho jaata hai. Phone mujhe apne se bachne deta hai during eating time bhi.

Yaar 'phone mujhe apne se bachne deta hai' - woh bahut honest observation hai. Past mistakes, future worries - woh sab andar hai aur phone se band kar raha hai apne aap ko. But jo andar hai woh jaata nahi - sirf quiet ho jaata hai. Ek din bina phone ke khao - even ek meal. Jo thoughts aayein, aane do. Agar woh self-criticism bahut heavy ho toh kisi se baat karna worth hai - woh voice andar hai jo tumhe hurt kar raha hai.
Yaar main har weekend ke liye plan karta hoon - movies, outings, meetups. But actual weekend aata hai toh ghar mein rahta hoon aur poora din social media scroll karta hoon. Roz yahi hota hai.
Plans banata hai but actual mein nahi jaata - yaar woh gap hai planning aur actually jaane mein. Weekend aane pe kya feel hota hai?

Bahut heavy feel hota hai honestly yaar. Like getting ready, going out - everything feels like too much effort. Body mein energy nahi hoti. Lagta hai ki sirf bahar jaana plan karna enough hai - that's already exhausting.
Sab kuch too much effort feel hota hai, energy nahi hoti - yaar woh sirf laziness nahi hai clearly. Woh heaviness kab se hai - sirf weekends pe hai ya din bhar bhi aisa feel hota hai?

Din bhar bhi hai yaar honestly. Kaam pe jaata hoon because I have to - but andar se empty feel hota hai. Raat ko neend bhi nahi aati properly. Kabhi kabhi lagta hai ki kisi cheez mein interest nahi hai mujhe - kuch bhi achha nahi lagta anymore. Scroll karna bas ek aisi cheez hai jo time pass kar deta hai.

Yaar 'kisi cheez mein interest nahi, kuch achha nahi lagta' - woh actually important hai ki tumne yeh bola. Woh emptiness, energy nahi, neend nahi, andar se nothing matters feeling - yaar please listen. Yeh sirf addiction ya laziness nahi hai. Yeh depression ke signs hain possibly. Scroll karna sirf time pass kar raha hai kyunki andar kuch feel nahi ho raha. Please ek baar kisi doctor se baat karo honestly - all of this, as-is. You deserve to feel something again.
I've been watching a lot of reality TV - like The Bachelor, Kardashians, dating shows. Every night, 2-3 hours. I know it's mindless but I can't stop watching.
2-3 hours every night of reality TV - bro what is it about these shows specifically that keeps you watching?

I think it's because it makes my life feel less bad by comparison? Like watching other people's drama makes me feel like my problems aren't that big. And honestly it's also kind of exciting - like living someone else's life through the screen.
'Living someone else's life' and 'my problems aren't that big' - bro does that mean your own life feels kind of heavy right now?

Yeah honestly my life feels really stagnant. Same routine every day, I'm single, my friends are all getting married or moving away. I feel like I'm watching everyone else live exciting lives while mine just... exists. Reality TV at least gives me something to feel something about.

Yaar 'my life just exists' - woh feeling is really heavy bro. Watching everyone move forward while you feel stuck. The shows give you emotion because your own life isn't giving you enough right now. But they're not going to fix that stagnant feeling - they're just filling the space. The real thing here is that you're lonely and feeling behind. That matters more than the TV. Even one small thing this week - reach out to one old friend, go somewhere new alone - just something that's yours, not someone else's drama on a screen.
Yaar main har roz online shopping kar raha hoon - clothes, accessories, shoes - sab kuch. Ek hafte mein 3-4 orders aate hain. Paisa jaata hai but khushi ek second ke liye milti hai.
Ek second ki khushi aur phir - yaar specifically kab zyada shopping hoti hai?

Jab ghar pe kuch argument hota hai ya koi bura event hota hai life mein toh seedha Amazon kholti hoon. Aur honestly raat ko akele hone pe bhi kaafi shopping hoti hai - jab dimag mein sab kuch chal raha hota hai.
Arguments ke baad ya raat ko akele - yaar argument ke baad specifically kya feel hota hai?

Mostly maa ke saath yaar. Woh lagti hain ki main enough nahi kar raha - studies, career, sab kuch. Aur mujhe lagta hai ki main kabhi unke expectations fulfill nahi kar sakta toh why even try. Shopping mein at least apne liye kuch choose kar sakta hoon - ek jagah hai jahan koi judge nahi karta.

Yaar maa ke expectations aur 'kabhi fulfill nahi kar sakta toh why try' - woh dono feelings bahut painful hain. Kabhi enough nahi hona - that's heavy andar. Shopping hai na jahan sirf tum decide karte ho kya choose karna hai - aisa control feel ho raha hai. But woh maa ke saath woh loop - expectations aur disappointment - woh shopping se nahi badlega. Ek baar honestly baat karo unse - sirf itna bolne ki ki 'mujhe lagta hai ki main kabhi enough nahi hoon.' Woh conversation mushkil hai but shayad wahi actually needed hai.

I've been using alcohol to fall asleep for about 2 years now. 2-3 drinks every night. Without it I just lie there for hours staring at the ceiling. My doctor told me to stop but I literally don't know how to sleep without it.
2 years every night and can't sleep without it - bro what was happening in your life when it first started?
That's when my mom got sick actually. I was taking care of her full time along with my job. Nights were the only time I could decompress and alcohol was the fastest way to shut my brain off.
Taking care of your mom while working full time - that's an incredibly heavy load bro. How is she doing now, and how are you doing with all of that?

She's better now thankfully. But I think I never actually processed how stressed and scared I was during that time. I just kept going. And now the alcohol stuck around even though the crisis is over. I think I'm afraid to feel whatever I didn't feel back then.

Yaar 'afraid to feel whatever I didn't feel back then' - that's a really important realization bro. You survived something really scary and heavy, and you never let yourself actually feel it.
